name: Found an open box HDFury VRROOM for a great price and went for it today. It will allow me to trick my projector into displaying Dolby Vision / LLDV content. Results on AVSForum look stunning. Excited!

name: The great “Install Win 10 amd64 in UTM on my M1 Mac” experiment has commenced, and is progressing well. How will it end? Will our hero survive and overcome the architectural divide? Will USB passthrough function? Stay tuned for our exciting conclusion!

content.html: The great “Install Win 10 amd64 in UTM on my M1 Mac” experiment has commenced, and is progressing well. How will it end? Will our hero survive and overcome the architectural divide? Will USB passthrough function? Stay tuned for our exciting conclusion!

summary: @fgtech oh amazing! Its a really great projector, and we're loving it so far. I have gripes, of course (the focus interface is terrible, some issues with dynamic contrast, etc.), but its definitely been a great investment.Once we get the firmware update done, I am going to be paying for a professional ISF calibration. I'll probably stick with my own calibration using Dirac Live for the sound.

content.html:
@fgtech oh amazing! Its a really great projector, and we're loving it so far. I have gripes, of course (the focus interface is terrible, some issues with dynamic contrast, etc.), but its definitely been a great investment.
Once we get the firmware update done, I am going to be paying for a professional ISF calibration. I'll probably stick with my own calibration using Dirac Live for the sound.
content.value: @fgtech oh amazing! Its a really great projector, and we're loving it so far. I have gripes, of course (the focus interface is terrible, some issues with dynamic contrast, etc.), but its definitely been a great investment.Once we get the firmware update done, I am going to be paying for a professional ISF calibration. I'll probably stick with my own calibration using Dirac Live for the sound.

name: My projector will receive a firmware update soon that dramatically improves black levels and handling of 24fps content. The bad news? The upgrade process requires me to order a bizarre Chinese remote and to connect the projector to a computer running Windows. Which I don’t have.

content.html: My projector will receive a firmware update soon that dramatically improves black levels and handling of 24fps content. The bad news? The upgrade process requires me to order a bizarre Chinese remote and to connect the projector to a computer running Windows. Which I don’t have.

name: This Netflix password sharing thing is going to be a pain in the ass. We split time between two locations, and now we will have to do gymnastics to continue to use Netflix. Honestly, they’ve fallen so far in quality, I may just cancel it.

content.html: This Netflix password sharing thing is going to be a pain in the ass. We split time between two locations, and now we will have to do gymnastics to continue to use Netflix. Honestly, they’ve fallen so far in quality, I may just cancel it.

summary: @jonathan My ISP right now changes my IP address regularly (I really need to change to a better plan, but that’s a separate issue)… I’ve received HUNDREDS of emails from Netflix in the past year informing me “a new device is using your account”I can’t see how this will end well for me.

content.html:
@jonathan My ISP right now changes my IP address regularly (I really need to change to a better plan, but that’s a separate issue)… I’ve received HUNDREDS of emails from Netflix in the past year informing me “a new device is using your account”
I can’t see how this will end well for me.
content.value: @jonathan My ISP right now changes my IP address regularly (I really need to change to a better plan, but that’s a separate issue)… I’ve received HUNDREDS of emails from Netflix in the past year informing me “a new device is using your account”I can’t see how this will end well for me.
